required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Misfolded Proteins in the Skin of People With Parkinson's Disease and Other Parkinsonism
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Skin Biomarkers for Preclinical Diagnosis of PD and Non-PD Parkinsonism

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS)
National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)
Universidad Autonoma de San Luis Potos√≠

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether identification of misfolded proteins in the skin will help to determine what sort of parkinsonism someone has. We seek to demonstrate whether someone has a synucleinopathy such as Parkinson's disease (PD), multiple system atrophy (MSA), or dementia with Lewy bodies(DLB), as opposed to a tauopathy such as progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) or corticobasal degeneration (CBD) or no parkinsonism at all (control).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a clinical research study for patients with parkinsonism, including Parkinson's disease, progressive supranuclear palsy, corticobasal degeneration, multiple system atrophy, and dementia with Lewy bodies. Parkinsonism can be difficult to diagnose, especially in the early stages of the disease. Skin punch biopsy could be a useful and way to diagnose and measure the severity of these conditions. Given that there currently is no proven way to determine that someone has a synucleinopathy such as PD and not a tauopathy, this is a novel study that may lead to better ways to diagnose people with parkinsonism. The purpose of the study is to identify changes on a skin punch biopsy, in which small samples of skin are removed and sent to the laboratory for examination. We are seeking to measure the amount of misfolded alpha-synuclein in someone's skin. Participation will last between 1 and 2 years and will involve between 2 and 4 visits. Visits will include a physical examination, questionnaires, a memory test, blood draws, and a single visit for skin punch biopsies. We will also be looking to enroll volunteers to serve as "controls," who do not have any neurological illness.

primary_outcome.measure: Amount of alpha-synuclein in the skin
primary_outcome.description: Alpha-synuclein will be measured by RT-QuIC and sPMCA

primary_outcome.measure: Change in PSPRS measures of progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) severity in people with PSP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire and examination. Lower scores are better.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in UMSARS measures of multiple system atrophy (MSA) severity in people with MSA
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire and examination. Lower scores are better.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hoehn and Yahr (H&Y) and modified H&Y Scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
primary_outcome.description: Zero to 5 parkinsonism rating scale score. Lower score is better.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Schwab and England (S&E) Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
primary_outcome.description: 0% to 100% rating scale score. Higher score is better.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Zero to 30 cognitive rating scale score. Higher score is better.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Zero to 24 sleepiness rating scale score. Lower score is better.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
secondary_outcome.description: 17 item depression rating scale score. Lower score is better.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
secondary_outcome.description: 14 item depression rating scale score. Lower score is better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in REM Behavior Disorder Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
secondary_outcome.description: 10 item depression rating scale score. Lower score is better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood pressure with orthostatic posture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 year, and optional 2 year assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure from lying down to sitting to standing. Smaller drop in blood pressure is better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of alpha-synuclein in the blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, optional 1 year assessment, and optional 2 year assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Alpha-synuclein will be measured in the blood sample

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, optional 1 year assessment, and optional 2 year assessment
secondary_outcome.description: 39 item health status questionnaire. Lower is better.

arm_group.description: Participants with Parkinson's disease (PD), dementia with Lewy bodies (DLB), multiple system atrophy (MSA), progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP), and corticobasal degeneration (CBD)

intervention.description: An anesthetic medication is injected to numb the areas of skin and two samples of skin are obtained from punch biopsy.

biospec_descr.textblock: Skin and blood samples are collected and used for analysis in the Case Western Reserve University Department of Pathology. Blood samples are obtained for NIH affiliated biobanks BioSEND/PDBP and RUCDR.

study_pop.textblock: People with parkinsonism, Parkinson's disease (PD), dementia with Lewy bodies (DLB), multiple system atrophy (MSA), progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP), and corticobasal degeneration (CBD), and also controls without parkinsonism.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 21 years old and age <90 years of age at the time of the baseline visit 1
- Age of diagnosis at least 40 years old for PD, DLB, and PSP and at least 30 years old for MSA
- A confirmed diagnosis of PD, PSP, CBD, MSA, DLB, or healthy control
- Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) > 10 at the outset of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age 90 or above
- Allergy to local anesthetic
- History of deep brain stimulation (DBS) or other brain surgery prior to Visit 1
- For PD or DLB diagnoses, any other neurodegenerative or central nervous system process that would interfere with examination
- For PD or DLB, history of negative DATscan
- Use of investigational drugs or devices within 60 days prior to baseline visit (except for dietary supplements)
- In control subjects, family history of a neurodegenerative disease in a first degree or second degree blood relative
- History of schizophrenia
- History of antipsychotic medication use or exposure in controls or history of antipsychotic medication leading to parkinsonism (drug induced parkinsonism) in the parkinsonism group
- Blood clotting disorder
- On multiple (more than one) antiplatelet and/or anticoagulant blood thinner medications in combination (except for aspirin if it can be safely held for 1 week)
- Any other medical, psychiatric, or cognitive illness that in the investigator's opinion would interfere with cooperation or ability to undergo the study procedures.

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center and Case Western Reserve University
